metadata.title: CVE-2021-39275 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
ap_escape_quotes() may write beyond the end of a buffer when givenmalicious input. No included modules pass untrusted data to thesefunctions, but third-party / external modules may. This issue affectsApache HTTP Server 2.4.48 and earlier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39275` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2').
apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm2').
